headline.main: World Briefing | Middle East: Egypt: Concern Over Monitored Web Sites

lead_paragraph: Human rights advocates expressed concern that the police are monitoring what the authorities call ''immoral'' Web sites. Last week the monitoring unit arrested Shohdy Naguib after he posted his father's banned poems on the Internet. One of the poems by Naguib Sorour, who died in 1978, condemned Egyptian leaders in graphic language for losing the 1967 war with Israel. Abeer Allam (NYT)
abstract: Human rights advocates in Egypt express concern that police are monitoring Web sites; cite arrest of Shohdy Naguib after he posted poem condemning Egyptian leaders (S)
